1.t: By Qaf and the glorious Quran, (you are the Messenger of God).

2.t: In fact, it seems odd (to the pagans) that a warner from their own people has come to them. The disbelievers have said, "It is very strange
2.tr: Bal 'ajibooo an jaa'ahum munzirum minhum faqaalal kaafiroona haazaa shai'un 'ajeeb

3.t: that after we die and become dust, we shall be brought back to life again. This seems far from reality".
3.tr: A-izaa mitnaa Wa-kunnaa turaaban zaalika raj'um ba'eed

4.t: We already know how much of them (of their bodies) the earth will consume. With Us there is a Book that contains all records.
4.tr: Qad 'alimnaa maa tanqu-sul ardu minhum Wa-'indanaa Kitaabun Hafeez

5.t: In fact, they have rejected the truth that has come to them, thus, they live in confusion.
5.tr: Bal kazzaboo bilhaqqi lammaa jaaa'ahum fahum feee amrim mareej

6.t: Have they not seen how We have established the sky above them and decked it without gaps and cracks?
6.tr: Afalam yanzurooo ilas samaaa'i fawqahum kaifa banainaahaa Wa-zaiyannaahaa Wa-maa lahaa min furooj

7.t: (Have they not seen) how We have spread out the earth, placed on it firm mountains and have made all kinds of flourishing pairs of plants grow?
7.tr: Wal-arda madadnaahaa Wa-alqainaa feehaa rawaasiya Wa-ambatnaa feehaa min kulli zawjim baheej

8.t: This is a reminder and it sharpens the insight of every servant of God who turns to Him in repentance.

9.t: We have sent blessed water down from the sky to grow gardens, harvestable crops
9.tr: Wa-nazzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'am mubaarakan fa-ambatnaa bihee jannaatinw Wa-habbal haseed

10.t: and tall palm-trees with clusters of dates

11.t: as sustenance for My servants. With this We have brought the dead land back to life. Thus, will also be your resurrection.
11.tr: Rizqal lil'ibaad, Wa-ahyainaa bihee baldatam maitaa; kazaalikal khurooj

12.t: The people of Noah, dwellers of the Ra's, Thamud,
12.tr: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohinw Wa-Ashaabur Rassi Wa-Samood

14.t: dwellers of the forest, and the people of Tubba had all rejected the Prophets. Thus, they became subject to Our torment.
14.tr: Wa-Ashaabul Aykati Wa-qawmu Tubba'; kullun kazzabar Rusula fahaqqa wa'eed

15.t: Did We fail to accomplish the first creation? Of course, We did not; We have all power over all things. Yet they are confused about a new creation.
15.tr: Afa'a-yeenaa bilkhalqil awwal; bal hum fee labsim min khalqin jadeed

16.t: We swear that We have created the human being and We know what his soul whispers to him. We are closer to him than even his jugular vein.
16.tr: Wa-laqad khalaqnal insaana Wa-na'lamu maa tuwaswisu bihee nafsuhoo Wa-Nahnu aqrabu ilaihi min hablil wareed

17.t: Since the two scribes are sitting on each of his shoulders, he does not utter a word which is not recorded immediately by the watchful scribes.
17.tr: Iz yatalaqqal mutalaqqi-yaani 'anil yameeni Wa-'anish shimaali qa'eed

18.t: The human being will certainly experience the agony of death
18.tr: Maa yalfizu min qawlin illaa ladaihi raqeebun 'ateed

19.t: and (the human being will be told), "This is what you had been trying to run away from".
19.tr: Wa-jaaa'at sakratul mawti bilhaqq; zaalika maa kunta minhu taheed

20.t: The trumpet will certainly be sounded. This will be the day (about which you) were threatened.
20.tr: Wa-nufikha fis Soor; zaalika yawmul wa'eed

21.t: Every soul will be accompanied (by an angel) behind him and another as a witness.
21.tr: Wa-jaaa'at kullu nafsim ma'ahaa saaa'iqunw Wa-shaheed

22.t: (He will be told), "You were completely heedless of this day. We have removed the veil from your eyes and your vision will now be sharp and strong".
22.tr: Laqad kunta fee ghaf-latim min haazaa fakashafnaa 'anka ghitaaa'aka fabasarukal yawma hadeed

23.t: His (angelic) companion will say, "(Lord), the record of his deeds is with me and is all ready".

24.t: (They will be told,) "Throw into hell every persistent disbelievers,

25.t: who is an opponent of good, a suspicious transgressor

26.t: and an idol worshipper. Throw him into severe torment".
26.tr: Allazee ja'ala ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fa-alqiyaahu fil 'azaabish shadeed

27.t: His satanic companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not mislead him, but he himself went astray".
27.tr: Qaala qareenuhoo Rabbanaa maaa atghaituhoo Wa-laakin kaana fee dalaalin ba'eed

28.t: The Lord will say, "Do not argue in My presence; I had certainly sent you a warning.
28.tr: Qaala laa takhtasimoo ladaayya Wa-qad qaddamtu ilaikum bilwa'eed

29.t: No word is to be exchanged in My presence. I am not unjust to My servants".
29.tr: Maa yubaddalul qawlu ladaiya Wa-maaa ana bizal-laamil lil'abeed

30.t: On that day We shall ask hell, "Are you full?" It will say, "Are there any more?"
30.tr: Yawma naqoolu li'jahannama halim talaati Wa-taqoolu hal mim mazeed

31.t: Paradise will be brought near for the pious ones

32.t: (and they will be told), "This is what you were promised. It is for everyone who turned in repentance to God, kept his promise,
32.tr: Haaza maa too'adoona likulli awwaabin hafeez

33.t: feared the Beneficent God in secret, and turned to Him with a repenting heart".
33.tr: Man khashiyar Rahmaana bilghaibi Wa-jaaa'a biqalbim muneeb

34.t: (They will be told), "Enter Paradise in peace and, therein, you will live forever".

35.t: They will have therein whatever they want and will receive from Us more rewards
35.tr: Lahum maa yashaaa'oona feehaa Wa-ladainaa mazeed

36.t: How many an ancient town who were much stronger than them (unbelievers) did We destroy. (In vain), they wandered through the land in search of a place of refuge from Our torment.
36.tr: Wa-kam ahlaknaa qablahum min qarnin hum ashaddu minhum batshan fanaqqaboo fil bilaad, hal mim mahees

37.t: This is a reminder for everyone who understands, listens, and sees.
37.tr: Inna fee zaalika lazikraa liman kaana lahoo qalbun aw alqas sam'a Wa-huwa shaheed

38.t: We created the heavens, the earth, and all that is between them in six days without experiencing any fatigue.
38.tr: Wa-laqad khalaqnas samaawaati wal-arda Wa-maa bainahumaa fee sittati ayyaamin Wa-maa massanaa mil lughoob

39.t: (Muhammad), exercise patience against what they say. Glorify your Lord with His praise before sunrise and sunset.
39.tr: Fasbir 'alaa maa yaqooloona Wa-sabbih bihamdi Rabbika qabla tuloo'ish shamsi Wa-qablal ghuroob

40.t: Glorify Him during the night and also glorify Him after prostration.

41.t: Wait for the day when the trumpet will be sounded from a nearby place.
41.tr: Wastami' yawma yunaa-dil munaadi mim makaanin qareeb

42.t: On that day they will certainly hear the sound of the trumpet and that will be the Day of Resurrection.
42.tr: Yawma yasmaoonas sai-hata bilhaqq zaalika yawmul khurooj

43.t: We give life and cause things to die. To Us all things will return.
43.tr: Innaa Nahnu nuhyee Wa-numeetu Wa-ilainal maseer

44.t: On the day when the earth is rent asunder, they will quickly come out of their graves. This is how easy it is for Us to bring about the Day of Resurrection.
44.tr: Yawma tashaqqaqul ardu 'anhum siraa'aa; zaalika hashrun 'alainaa yaseer

45.t: We know best what they say and you cannot compel them. Remind, by way of the Quran, those who have fear of My warnings.
45.tr: Nahnu a'lamu bimaa yaqooloona Wa-maaa anta 'alaihim bijabbaarin fazakkir bil-quraani maien yakhaafu wa'eed
